alert.note: Alert for Bowie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 16 at 4:26PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas and northeast Texas, including the following counties, in southwest Arkansas, Miller. In northeast Texas, Bowie. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 425 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Texarkana is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Texarkana, Wake Village, Nash and Mandeville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
